pullRequest.title: Feature: Provide multiple templates for a programming language
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context
Currently, there can only be one template per programming exercise. For Java, often two exercise types are used: Eclipse projects and Maven projects. Instructors currently have to manually adjust the exercise if they want to use Maven exercises.
See #2062.
Description
This PR adds an attribute projectType to the Programming Exercises, defaulting to null. Each programming language has a base template (consisting of the already present folder exercise, solution, tests, which can be extended by project-specific files (e.g. pom.xml or .project files). The selection is not shown if there is only one template for this programming language.
The Project Type can not be changed after creating the exercise as the repositories are setup with the selected option during exercise creation.
Steps for Testing

Create a new programming exercise
See the new selection for the project type when select Java as programming language.
See the difference in the loaded README when selecting Maven instead of Eclipse
Create one project using Maven and one using Eclipse.


The eclipse project should be identical to the previous template.
The maven project should be identical except that 1) a pom.xml file is generated for student instead of .classpath and .project file. 2) The Client class uses a method from Apache RandomUtils.


Import both exercises into eclipse (one as eclipse project and one as maven project), you should be able to run the main method in the Client class.
Create another non-Java Programming exercise: The project type selection should not be present but you should still be able to create the exercise using the default template.

Test Coverage


ExerciseService.java: 85%
programming-exercise.component.ts 95%

Screenshots

commit.message: Change order of eclipse and maven.
Adjust formatting of pom.xml in maven template

nodes.bodyText: Codacy found an issue: Assigning an Object to null is a code smell.  Consider refactoring.
